TF034890-MOLDOVA - STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT
            LOAN II,TF034242-MOLDOVA - STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT LOAN,TF021181-SECOND STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Structural Adjustment Loan
            and Credit Project (SAL II) will support the
            Government's reforms necessary to create conditions for
            a resumption of growth and improvement in living conditions
            in Moldova. To achieve this objective, critical reforms need
            to be undertaken in: i) improving financial discipline; ii)
            privatizing the energy sector; iii) accelerating land reform
            and privatization; iv) reforming the pension system; and v)
            completing enterprise privatization, specially for
            small-scale enterprises. SAL II will have three fundamental
            benefits. First, the reform program supported by the SAL II
            will address key bottlenecks, and enhance the prospects of
            long-term growth and improved living standards by setting in
            place a comprehensive program of reforms that will span the
            1998 Parliamentary elections. Second, it will provide
            short-term budgetary support essential for maintaining the
            level of basic public services. The availability of low
            cost, non-inflationary budgetary financing will help
            consolidate Moldova's economic stabilization. Third, it
            will provide necessary foreign exchange to purchase imports
            critical for Moldova's economic activity while
            maintaining creditworthiness. Finally, measures supported by
            SAL II --payments discipline and completion of privatization
            and land reform-- are necessary conditions for sustainable
            growth and creditworthiness.
